item.title: Changing Header Colors in Jekyll's Minima Theme
item.author: dajhub
item.description: Jekyll supports a range of themes and while I have tried a few I decided to use Jekyll’s default Jekyll theme, ‘Minima’, which this site is based on. It works well out of the box. However, over time I have made a few changes. The most recent change was with the sites sub-headings. I had been using H2 headings in markdown but always felt they were too large. If I used H3 headings then sub-headings seemed to get lost in the text!
